intro: Dasistoma, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plants typically have showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. They are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Dasistoma species are valued for their ornamental beauty and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
